metadata.titel_preek: Being on the Gigantic Stage with Jesus

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of a blind beggar (Bartimaeus) through an encounter with Jesus, leading to discipleship.

tekstueel_bewijs: He musters his energy to voice his urgent need.
He addresses Jesus... He calls loud.
He took off his cloak, and sprang up and came to Jesus.
Transformative action that will change his life circumstance.

zender.identificatie: The Hebrew Scriptures/The Promises of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Bartimaeus has been reading the Hebrew Scriptures... he knows interpretive moves.
David was the Old Testament character who carried the big promises of God.
He reckoned himself to be a part of that community of God’s promises.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly invited to identify with the Subject (the one acting/choosing).

tekstueel_bewijs: He is the big reliable connector between the plight of the world and the mercy of the God.
helper.rol_van_god: Jesus is positioned as the Helper/Instrument who facilitates the Subject's (Bartimaeus) desire.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent; replaced by human 'faith' as the internal power.

tekstueel_bewijs: They sternly ordered him to be quiet.
The censoring crowd or the self-protective disciples.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opposition is not Sin or Death, but social pressure and religious exclusion.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer choosing a role to play on the 'gigantic stage'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon shifts from Bartimaeus's story to a menu of roles the hearer must choose to perform, making the primary story a script for the secondary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God of all mercy who dominates the gigantic stage.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We get to choose which part we will play.

voorbeelden: He knew he must speak up.
We get to choose which part we will play.
He wanted to be a part of that.
Imagine... and take up your many roles.
He could not see him, but he felt the buzz.
Your faith has made you well.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the hearer's will and imagination to choose a role, rather than God's power to create a new reality.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Blindness) to ~S2 (Crying out) to S1 (Sight/Following).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the Subject's 'faith' and 'choice' to step onto the stage.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; blindness is treated as a 'disadvantage' rather than a state of spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of mercy, the actantial engine is anthropocentric. The 'Gigantic Stage' metaphor turns the Gospel into a performance where the hearer is the lead actor choosing their role.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We get to choose which part we will play.
Jesus—the one with transformative power... carrier of mercy.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus took the initiative. Jesus summoned him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Bartimaeus is presented as a model of 'mustering energy' and 'faith' for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus as the Son of David who seeks out the blind because they cannot seek Him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'perform' correctly or 'choose' the right role.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the stage and the power, but man provides the performance and the choice.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of the 'stage' creates a coherent literary frame but clashes with the theology of 'mercy' which implies helplessness.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: We could play the role of Jesus and perform transformations.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'faith' of the human subject provides the competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Low; sin is 'shushing' others or having 'no hope'.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (by performing transformations on the stage).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to action (Vouloir-faire) rather than a proclamation of God's act. Jesus is a character in our drama rather than us being characters in His.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'choosing' and 'performing'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who 'casts' us and 'heals' us regardless of our performance.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We get to choose which part we play,' use 'Jesus has cast you in His drama of grace.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'one who does the healing'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Bartimaeus followed Jesus because he was healed, not to finish the healing.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on 'Your faith has made you well' as a gift from Jesus rather than a work of Bartimaeus.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'blindness' as a spiritual dead-end that only a miracle can fix.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make 'mercy' truly mercy, the need must be beyond human 'mustering of energy'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (playing the role) is fused with Soteriology (being healed).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Jesus heals the helpless (Soteriology). 2. The healed follow (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The 'Gigantic Stage' is a brilliant rhetorical device, but ensure the spotlight stays on the Director (God) rather than the actors' choices.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is engaging and imaginative. Actantially, it is moralistic because the 'engine' of the story is human choice.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes Bartimaeus's cry; semiotics notes that the sermon makes that cry a 'competence' the hearer must replicate.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that Jesus is reduced to a 'Helper' (Adjuvant) for the human 'Subject' (Bartimaeus/Hearer).

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'theatre' metaphor which inherently prioritizes human performance over divine monergism.
